resources.string: Mechatricians is type of event in which you are going to face a lot of technical terms of mechanical division.
In this round, simple test of your knowledge about mechanical machinery and tools.
In this round, there will be race of bots which will be full of excitement and problems as well. Hurdles are to be passed to clear the round.
This round is surprise round and will be disclosed at the time of competition.
The robot can be wired or wireless. In case of wireless, participants must take care of selecting suitable bandwidth such that there is no interference.
The robot can be powered by Maximum of 12V DC supply.
Not more than 300 rpm of DC motor is allowed
The scientist is type of event in which the participants are tested on the basis of their circuit designing and problem solving skill through various questions and problem statement.
\"With sound knowledge of mechanical components and your fast n furious skills, you can crack the two rounds to unveil the surprise.\"
\"Apply your knowledge of circuit analysis and problem solving ability to solve a practical life situation and test your trading skills to achieve top ranks.\"
This round consists of a MCQ test which will test the participant’s proficiency in circuit analysis, problem solving ability and general aptitude. Top 15 participants will proceed to next round.

A Storyline will be given to each participant and the requirements of the circuit or system they need to design will be indicated in the story itself. The evaluation of points earned will be on the basis of time taken for designing, working of circuit, response of the circuit. Designing of circuit and its explanation will be handwritten and no hardware implementation will be performed. Top 5 teams will proceed to next round
From the points earned in last round, the participants will purchase components by trading those points and make a system out of those components.
The decision of jury is final and cannot be challenged or questioned in any way.
The given objective should be completed in given amount of time, late submission may lead to negative marking.
Hints will be provided in round 1 and 2 if required by the participant.
The circuit implemented by participants in round 3 will be a take away one (students can take circuit along with them)

In this event you have to answer general questions, picture perceptions, presentation, etc. and much more. This event “smart-o-fast “ consist of three rounds. There will be a mixture of technical as well as non technical questions.
\"Talking about tall and magnificent buildings, answer some concrete questions, take a sneak peek and enhance presentation skill.\"

In this round you will be given a question paper with 40 questions in it, questions will be there in the form of “multiple choice “, “blanks”. The contestants will be short listed and will further qualify to 2nd round.

This round will be the buzzer round, the one with the fastest click will be given the first chance to answer. In this round there will be a team of 2 students (1st student of 1st year and 2nd student of 2nd year civil). There would be a negative marking for wrong answer. After this round 5 teams will qualify to 3rd round.
In this round participants will be given a topic related to civil engineering and they have to make a presentation on that topic, your presentation will be evaluated by the respected judges.
\"CODERS, here we bring you e-treasure hunt and present your Wall Street skills to bid and get the best algorithms.\"
Solve the Errors in Program and Top 12 teams will qualified for the next round.
Every Team Will have to find their task from their respective machines(PC).

list of things will be given to every team. They have to beg, borrow or steal those things from anywhere in the campus and submit it to respective co-ordinators. The co-ordinator will give a program definition to their respective team and the team will have to perform that program.
Virtual money will be provided to each team. One program between two teams and list of algorithms will be given. Team has to bet to earn the algorithm.
There should be exact two participants in each team.
Team should choose their language of event at the time of registration only.
Terrorist v/s Counter Terrorist. Rounds will be according to total registered teams.
\"The game of millennium is here..!! Time for HEADSHOTS, not SELFIES..! Backup your team and strike hard… BAMM..!!\"

This event simulates the sport of football with wired robots as on field players and the participant teams. Wired robots will be provided by ISTE team. Two teams will compete at a time. The event is designed as a tournament and each team to lose a game will be eliminated accordingly.
\"All have seen legendary players playing soccer, but ever thought about bots playing the sport..!! Give it a shot…\"
The first team to score a goal wins. If no team scores a goal, decision will be given on the basis of penalty shootout.
Each game will be of 5 min duration. If no result comes, winner will be decided from penalty shootout.
Decision of referee will be final and cannot be challenged in any way.
Any kind of nuisance in field may lead to disqualification of team.
Contestants are required to check the robots before starting the match.
Photographer? Come and show your artistic mind by snapping best pics of our ongoing events and get awarded.
Each participant has to submit 10 best photos(digital copy) which they have clicked.
Only on-going events or in-campus photos at the time of event will be judged.
Registration is mandatory for all participants at the begining of the event. Without registration your photos will not be accepted. And registration desk will be at foyer.
Only one winner will be chosen by judge on basis of creativity.
Any digital camera model and its accessories are allowed.

Python is a widely used general-purpose, high-level programming language. Its design philosophy emphasizes code readability, and its syntax allows programmers to express concepts in fewer lines of code than would be possible in languages such as C++ or Java. The language provides constructs intended to enable clear programs on both a small and large scale.
Manoranjan Padhy holds the position of Organizer / Manager at Python Developers, Baroda. He is also the Technical Speaker and Developer Expert for Cloud Services at Google Developers Group, Baroda.

On Thursday, 13th August 2015, GCET ISTE Student Chapter Organized a Lecture on “Space Technology for Disaster Management” for the students of mechanical, chemical and mechatronics department. In the current scenario, disaster management is very crucial. And being an engineer one should have adequate knowledge of the same. Space technology plays a crucial role in the present disaster management techniques. It helps in monitoring various natural phenomenon and in building efficient and reliable early warning systems. It helps in data collection, monitoring, and mapping.

The session was conducted by Dr P M Udani (Director, Institute of Science and Technology for Advanced Studies and Research (ISTAR) V.V. Nagar. The session was about introduction to various devices and systems, related to space technology, that are used in disaster management. Students got a glance at all the programs related to disaster management system that are going on at ISRO. Dr P M Udani sir had been a part of some of those projects. He shared some of his experiences from his time at ISRO. It was a great learning experience for the students.

On 11th-12th August 2015, GCET Mechanical department and ISTE Student Chapter Organized an Event “Quiz – O - Mania” for the students of 2nd and 3rd year mechanical. In recent times, the competitive examinations have increased and in almost every field one has to face them. So one should have a good knowledge about the things happening around oneself and aptitude. Keeping in mind the same fact, we at Iste, had organized an event “Quiz –O-Mania”.

The event consisted of 3 rounds. The first round was a written test. It consisted of questions of G.K, Aptitude and Quantitative Ability. It was an elimination round mainly focused on checking the reasoning skills and G.K of the contestants. A total of 50 students appeared for it and 31 made it to the second round.

Second round was a Group Discussion Round. The selected participants were divided into 4 groups and each group discussed on one of the following topics, Social Networking: boon or bane, Indian villages : good or bad, Smart cities: required or not, Should government encourage IITs and IIMS or primary education This round judged by H.R.T sir and V.D sir. After the completion of the G.D. Students were briefed by our esteemed judges and the coordinators on the various aspects of a group discussion and about the do’s and don’ts of a G.D. Students became aware about the G.D pattern and how to present themselves.
From the 2nd round, 12 students were selected for the final clash in the 3rd round, Interactive Quiz. In the 3rd round, 6 teams were formed having 2 players per team.

The 3rd round consists of 3 stages namely horse riding, chose the maze and decision maker. Participants thoroughly enjoyed the quiz. After the completion of the last round prizes were distributed to the winners and runners up by the HOD of mechanical department, Dr Darshak desai. The event helped the participants in widening their scope of G.K and learning new things like G.D. It also helped the organizers a lot. We managed to get a decent number of entries though in a limited period and with limited resources. We learned how to manage time and resources effectively.
All in all it was a great experience for both the participants and the organizers. And we hope to have such events in the future.

I would like to thank Mrs. Ela Jha for her constant guidance and encouragement throughout the event. She had been a great support for all of us. And last but not the least to the HOD of mechanical department, Dr Darshak Desai sir for giving us the required permissions and resources for the success of the event.
